content.raw:
Suggest using `boost::filesystem::temp_directory_path()` to get the temporary directory, instead of assuming that `/tmp` will work (one of these days, we will run on Windows...).

Also, what happens if multiple instance of gazebo are running simultaneously?  Should each one use a unique path to store terrain pages (e.g., via `boost::filesystem::unique_path()`)?
